div.p: RAY: So you've got the low-risk guidelines?
ANTONIO: I think so. Low-risk for alcohol means following the 0-1-2-3 guidelines.... One in an hour, two drinks daily, and no more than three on any one day.
RAY: That's exactly right. Of course, that adds up to no more than 14 in a week, provided that we follow the no more than one in any hour and no more than three in any day part of the guidelines.
RAY: Anytime we go above these amounts, we have increased our risk for problems, so it's a high-risk choice.
RAY: Now of course, even if we keep our drinking in this range, it's not an absolute guarantee that we won't experience problems.
RAY: Some people do. But research tells us that by far, most people who keep their drinking within the low-risk range do not experience problems with alcohol.
ANTONIO: And zero is always a low-risk choice as well.
RAY: Yes, and in fact for all of us, there's times and places where zero may be the only low-risk choice, or the only low-risk choice consistent with the law or policies.
